reading.title: Why not try one of our top three family holidays?
A
reading.text: Comfortable family accommodation with private pool near the beach. Try windsurfing or even paragliding! Close to the lively resort of Faliraki with nightclubs, restaurants and shopping.
reading.image: White Cycladic-style buildings overlooking the sea — likely Santorini

reading.title: B
reading.text:
Week one: Orlando
• Visit world-class theme parks, like Wet'n'Wild and Disney World.
• Exciting restaurants and nightlife.

Week two: Everglades Nature Reserve
• World-famous wildlife including fish, birds and alligators.
• Free cycling, fishing and camping.
reading.image: People on a roller coaster — likely at a theme park in Orlando

reading.title: C
reading.text: Top city centre hotel, minutes from Big Ben and other famous sights. Close to world-famous theatres, restaurants, shops, markets, parks, galleries and museums. Includes half-day boat trip along the River Thames.
reading.image: London skyline with Tower Bridge and boats on the Thames

reading.title: Future arrangements
reading.text:
- So, are you going on holiday with your family this summer?
- Yeah, we're flying to Florida two days after the end of term.
- Cool ... who's going?
- Mum and Dad, obviously ... but my big sister's not coming this year, just my little brother.
- Oh well, nothing's perfect! What are you doing there?
- We're spending a week in Orlando, you know, visiting all the theme parks and stuff. Then we're staying in this place called the Everglades.
- What's that?
- It's a kind of nature reserve, with alligators and birds and stuff. We're going camping!
- It sounds really cool! You are so lucky!
- I know. I can't wait!

grammar.title: Future arrangements (Present Continuous)
grammar.explanation: Мы используем Present Continuous (настоящее продолженное время) для описания точных планов и договорённостей в будущем. Обычно указывается время или дата.

examples: We're flying to Florida next week.
My sister is not coming this year.
Are you going on holiday this summer?

rules.rule: ⚠️ Common mistake: Don't use 'will' for arranged personal plans
examples: ❌ I will meet you tomorrow. (casual future)

affirmative: We're flying to Florida next week.
I'm visiting my grandparents this weekend.
They're having a party next Saturday.
negative: My sister isn't coming this year.
I'm not going to the concert tomorrow.
They aren't meeting us at the airport.
questions: Are you going on holiday this summer?
Is she coming to the party tonight?
What time are we leaving tomorrow?

quiz.question: According to the text, why should you avoid long journeys with teenagers?
quiz.fb: Correct! The text says that long journeys can be boring.

quiz.question: Why is it recommended to plan excursions together?
options: So there is something for everyone.
quiz.fb: Correct! Planning together ensures there is something for everyone to enjoy.

quiz.question: What kind of accommodation does the Rhodes holiday offer?
options: A family house with a private pool.
quiz.fb: Correct! The Rhodes holiday features comfortable family accommodation with a private pool.

quiz.question: Which activity is available in Rhodes?
quiz.fb: Correct! You can try windsurfing or paragliding in Rhodes.

quiz.question: What can you see in the Everglades Nature Reserve?
quiz.fb: Correct! The Everglades is famous for wildlife including fish, birds, and alligators.

quiz.question: What is special about the London holiday package?
options: It includes a boat trip on the Thames.
It is near a sandy beach.
quiz.fb: Correct! The London holiday includes a half-day boat trip along the River Thames.

quiz.question: Who is Sophie going to Florida with?
quiz.fb: Correct! Sophie says her sister isn't coming, just her mum, dad, and little brother.

quiz.question: Why does the tip suggest finding a hotel with internet access?
options: To keep in touch with friends.
quiz.fb: Correct! Internet access allows teenagers to keep in touch with friends at home.

quiz.question: What does the word 'accommodation' mean?
options: A place to stay or live.
quiz.fb: Correct! Accommodation refers to a place where you live or stay, like a hotel.

quiz.question: What is an 'excursion'?
quiz.fb: Correct! An excursion is a short journey or trip, especially one taken as a leisure activity.

quiz.question: Which activity involves flying through the air?
quiz.fb: Correct! Paragliding involves gliding through the air with a parachute-like wing.

quiz.question: If you are 'sightseeing', what are you doing?
quiz.fb: Correct! Sightseeing means visiting interesting places and landmarks.

quiz.question: What is a 'resort'?
quiz.fb: Correct! A resort is a place where many people go for recreation and holidays.

quiz.question: Choose the correct sentence for a future arrangement.
options: I am meet my friends tomorrow.
quiz.fb: Correct! We use the present continuous (am/is/are + -ing) for future arrangements.

quiz.question: Complete the question: '_____ you _____ on holiday next week?'
quiz.fb: Correct! The correct form is 'Are you going' for a future plan.
